Author: Fai#0350
Content: Does Komodo have competitors? In terms of offering the ability to create a blockchain

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Sure

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: from the architecture point of view? none.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: no other platform so far to my knowledge lets it's creators create independent blockchain with just single command and few parameters.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: there are a lot out there who tie other [xyz]chains to their own main parent chain. kinda jail them to their ecosystem.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: from that point of view alone KMD does not have any competitor yet.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: unless I'm unaware of similar concept adopted by other project out there.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: ark

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: would be closest.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: hm... it lets user's create indipendent chains ?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: no need to download or have anything to link to ark mainnet chain ?

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: I think Ark is still tied to the main chain

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: the only similar to Komodo is Cosmos but not sure about every detail

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: https://cosmos.network/docs/introduction/cosmos-hub.html

Author: Fai#0350
Content: Nice nice. Then what is the difficulty level in building a token on top of our own blockchain. For example sake, building a Cryptokitties on top of Ethereum. In our case, building www.greenlink.io on top of our green/carbon positive currency called TreeLand

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
you want to make a token on top of your own independent blockchain ?
cryptokitties is a token on top of ETH.
You basically got your own ETH if you understand ETH is an independent blockchain, to like BTC, LTC etc.

Author: Fai#0350
Content: I spoke to @siu - Chainmakers and he said there was one such instance before. We‚Äôre thinking it could be quite expansive for us as we will have more projects who may need their own tokens, if they can‚Äôt be just a dApp on top of our Treeland coin

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: but if you still want to have a token system on top of your own independent blockchain you can also do so

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: There is tokens crypto-conditions smart contracts now

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: which applies to all asset chains

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: you can crate as many tokens on top of your asset chain

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I guess you want tokens to ICO etc ??

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: in that case you will not need to worry about tokens CC

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: your indepdent blockchain is your ICO tokens that you refer to as cryptokitties ERC20 tokens

Author: Fai#0350
Content: Cool. The reason we didn‚Äôt make GreenLink same level and layered on top of KMD is because we want the green cryptocurrency to be paid as fees when transactions happen. So each time a transaction happens a tree gets planted. At least one. So that means we can get up to 10 tokens on top of TreeLand and it will thrive as such

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
your usecase describes  assetchain and tokens on top of this assetchain.
can do now just with rpc commands. possible today.

Author: Fai#0350
Content: Hi, I've been reading the whitepapers of the past dico's on dexstats. They seem to mention themselves as cryptocurrencies but they also use "tokens" instead of coins. I wonder though in my case, TreeLand is a blockchain that will hopefully dico  and there could be projects that hopefully dico on top of TreeLand. So those projects will be paying transaction fees in TreeLand coins? Or TreeLand tokens? Considering the those projects will have their own tokens.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: tokens are from the assets CC, the txfee is paid in the native coin of the chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so if there is a TREELAND chain that other projects issue assets on, it is paid in TREELAND coins

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if OTHER coin is created for other projects, then txfee is paid in OTHER coins

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://www.coindesk.com/bitcoin-bug-exploited-on-crypto-fork-as-attacker-prints-235-million-pigeoncoins/

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: applying BTC bugs to the myriad of forks will get more common, and most forks can't hope to update fast enough

Author: Fai#0350
Content: I see. Would I be able to design it in such a way that projects that layer on top of TREELAND chain will (also?) pay "txfee" to TREELAND in TREELAND coin? Considering the projects have their own tokens too - say GreenLink has IMPACT tokens

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if they issue tokens using assets CC running on TREELAND, then that is exactly how it works

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
üëÜ  oh doood, no brainer being an ecosystem project.

got a re-org questions.
do the re-org rules say "we limit re-orgs to XX blocks" but because of dPoW the only re-org possible is since last notarization? and the "we limit re-org to XX blocks" is never reached with a notarization in place.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: most btc forks have a limit of 100 blocks

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so if they suddenly receive a valid chain that is trying to reorg >99 blocks, it will reject it

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: thanks, wasn't sure what the number was, but knew dPoW limited the re-org range in _that_ way

Author: Alright#0419
Content: the way some of them "reject" it is by shutting down the node itself

Author: Alright#0419
Content: which is a very very sloppy way of doing it as it allows someone to shut down remote nodes

Author: Mylo#8306

Author: Alright#0419
Content: BTC itself has that. It's very unlikely(if not impossible) for that to happen on BTC, but most coins leave it in without realizing it's there

Content: doesn't surprise me.  low level blockchain deving isn't a walk in the park/ it seems üòÑ
